sub_topic: Solving optimization problems using gradient descent method
message_1: Consider the function f(x) = x^2 - 3x + 5. Use the gradient descent method to find the minimum value of this function. Start with an initial guess of x = 0 and a learning rate of 0.1. Find the minimum value after 5 iterations.
message_2:
To use the gradient descent method, we need to find the derivative of the function f(x) with respect to x. This will give us the gradient or slope of the function at any point x.

f(x) = x^2 - 3x + 5

The derivative of f(x) with respect to x is:

f'(x) = 2x - 3

Now, we will use the gradient descent method to find the minimum value of the function. We start with an initial guess of x = 0 and a learning rate of 0.1. We will perform 5 iterations.

Iteration 1:
x1 = x0 - learning_rate * f'(x0)
x1 = 0 - 0.1 * (2*0 - 3)
x1 = 0 + 0.3
x1 = 0.3

Iteration 2:
x2 = x1 - learning_rate * f'(x1)
x2 = 0.3 - 0.1 * (2*0.3 - 3)
x2 = 0.3 + 0.24
x2 = 0.54

Iteration 3:
x3 = x2 - learning_rate * f'(x2)
x3 = 0.54 - 0.1 * (2*0.54 - 3)
x3 = 0.54 + 0.192
x3 = 0.732

Iteration 4:
x4 = x3 - learning_rate * f'(x3)
x4 = 0.732 - 0.1 * (2*0.732 - 3)
x4 = 0.732 + 0.1536
x4 = 0.8856

Iteration 5:
x5 = x4 - learning_rate * f'(x4)
x5 = 0.8856 - 0.1 * (2*0.8856 - 3)
x5 = 0.8856 + 0.12288
x5 = 1.00848

After 5 iterations, we have x ≈ 1.00848. Now, we can find the minimum value of the function f(x) at this point:

f(1.00848) = (1.00848)^2 - 3(1.00848) + 5
f(1.00848) ≈ 1.01697 - 3.02544 + 5
f(1.00848) ≈ 2.99153

After 5 iterations, the minimum value of the function f(x) = x^2 - 3x + 5 using the gradient descent method is approximately 2.99153.
